Package chess.model.pieces

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
chess.model.Colored
chess.model.pieces.Piece
All Implemented Interfaces:
chess.persistence.Codable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract sealed class Piece extends Colored permits Pawn, Rook, Knight, Bishop, Queen, King
An abstract and generic representation of a Chess piece, defined by:
  1. The Color (White or Black) to which the piece belongs.
  2. The position of the piece in the chessboard.
All Chess pieces:
  1. have a globally-unique identifier.
  2. maintain its move count.
In addition, this class also serves to dynamically instantiate specific types of Chess pieces and define the generic behaviors of all Chess pieces.

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece(Color color, Position position)
      Constructs this Piece with a color and a position at which it is placed.

      Upon instantiating, the piece's move count initializes to 0 and a Version 4 UUID that uniquely identifies the piece is generated.

      Parameters:
      color - The color of the piece.
      position - The position of the piece on a chessboard.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static Optional<Piece> of(String name, Color color, Position position)
      Constructs a Chess piece of the given name, color, and position.
      Parameters:
      name - The class name of the piece.
      Available options: "Pawn", "Rook", "Knight", "Bishop", "Queen", and "King".
      color - The color of the piece.
      position - The position of the piece.
      Returns:
      An optional new piece, which is empty if name is invalid.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.
      See Also:
      • Piece(Color, Position)

    • decode

      public static Piece decode(org.json.JSONObject jsonObject)
      Constructs an appropriate concrete subtype of Piece from a JSON object containing the following required key-value mappings: 
       {
     "color":"<color>",
     "piece":"<type>",
     "position":"<position>",
     "id":"<id>",
     "moveCount":<count>,
     ...
 }
      See Piece(JSONObject) for details.

      Note: Pawn requires an additional key-value mapping, see Pawn.encode() for details.

      Parameters:
      jsonObject - The source JSONObject from which to decode.
      Returns:
      An instance Piece decoded from the given JSON source.
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - If any of the required keys is missing or maps to an invalid value type.
      FormatException - Rethrown dynamically from the constructors, or if <type> is invalid.
      NullPointerException - If jsonObject is null.
      See Also:
      • encode()
      • Piece(JSONObject)

    • encode

      public org.json.JSONObject encode()
      Serializes this Piece to a JSON object of the following format: 
       {
     "color":"<color>",
     "piece":"<type>",
     "position":"<position>",
     "id":"<id>",
     "moveCount":<count>
 }
      where:
      • <type>: the class name of this piece returned from this.getClass().getSimpleName();
      • <position>: the string representation of the Position object, matching the pattern ^[a-hA-H][1-8]$;
      • <id>: the Version 4 UUID string of this piece;
      • <count>: an integer number of this piece's move count.
      Specified by:
      encode in interface chess.persistence.Codable
      Overrides:
      encode in class Colored
      Returns:
      A serialized object ready to be written.
      See Also:
      • Colored.encode()

      Returns:
      A copy of this piece.

    • getCharacterSymbol

      public final char getCharacterSymbol(boolean solid)
      Returns the character symbol that corresponds to this piece.
      Piece Character Symbols
      Piece White Black
      Pawn ♙ (\u2659) ♟ (\u265f)
      Rook ♖ (\u2656) ♜ (\u265c)
      Knight ♘ (\u2658) ♞ (\u265e)
      Bishop ♗ (\u2657) ♝ (\u265d)
      Queen ♕ (\u2655) ♛ (\u265b)
      King ♔ (\u2654) ♜ (\u265a)
      Parameters:
      solid - A boolean flag indicating whether this method should always return the Black version of the character symbol (the ones with solid glyph) regardless of the color of this piece.
      Returns:
      The unicode code point of the character symbol of this piece.

    • getCharacterSymbol

      public final char getCharacterSymbol()
      An overloaded version of getCharacterSymbol(boolean) that sets solid to false.
      Returns:
      The unicode code point of the character symbol of this piece.

    • getPoints

      public final int getPoints()
      Returns the number of points associated with this piece.
      Piece Values
      Piece Points
      Pawn 1
      Rook 5
      Knight 3
      Bishop 3
      Queen 9
      King 0
      Returns:
      The number of points of this piece according to the table above.

    • getCandidateMoves

      public abstract chess.util.List<Movement> getCandidateMoves(Chessboard chessboard)
      Computes and returns a list of candidate movements according to the rules of this piece and the current configuration of the chessboard.

      The movements returned from this method may be safe or unsafe, that is, the movements may or may not render their own King in check.

      Parameters:
      chessboard - The enclosing chessboard.
      Returns:
      A list of safe and unsafe candidate movements.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If chessboard is null.

    • getLegalMoves

      public final chess.util.List<Movement> getLegalMoves(Chessboard chessboard)
      Computes a list of safe (hence legal) candidate movements according to the rules of this piece and the current configuration of the chessboard, and updates the "checking" statuses of all candidate movements, i.e. updates the flag Movement.willCheckOpponent() to authentically reflect whether the movements would check the opponent.

      The process is as follows:

      1. candidate movements are executed to obtain hypothetical states of the chessboard;
      2. Chessboard.isInCheck(Color) is invoked to determine:
        1. if the allied King is in check;
        2. if the opponent is in check.
      3. movements that left their own King in check are removed;
      4. movements that check the opponent will have their flags updated to true;
      5. movements are undone and the chessboard is restored to its original state;
      6. if this is King, add Castling moves to the list.
      Parameters:
      chessboard - The enclosing chessboard.
      Returns:
      A list of safe candidate movements only.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If chessboard is null.

    • isAtAnInitialPosition

      public abstract boolean isAtAnInitialPosition()
      Note: This method returning true does NOT necessarily imply this piece IS at its initial position, unless this piece has only one possible initial position (e.g. Queen and King).
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether this piece may be at an initial position.

    • incrementMoveCount

      Increments the move count of this piece by one.

    • decrementMoveCount

      public final void decrementMoveCount()
      Decrements the move count of this piece by one.

      Does nothing when the move count is already 0.

      Resets the move count of this piece to 0.

    • toString

      public final String toString()
      The string representation of a Piece is of the form: 
       <symbol>@<position>
      where:
      • <symbol> is the character symbol returned from getCharacterSymbol();
      • <position> is of the pattern: ^[a-hA-H][1-8]$.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The string representation of this piece.
